HSTS forces browsers to use HTTPS for all future requests, preventing SSL stripping and downgrade attacks. Without it, users are vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks.

checks.message: X-Frame-Options header is missing. Site may be vulnerable to clickjacking.
X-Content-Type-Options is missing. Browsers may MIME-sniff responses.

checks.recommendation: Permissions-Policy: camera=(), microphone=(), geolocation=(), payment=(), usb=(), magnetometer=(), gyroscope=(), accelerometer=()
checks.detail: Permissions-Policy controls which browser features and APIs can be used. Without it, any embedded content could access sensitive features like camera and microphone.

checks.message: X-XSS-Protection is absent — acceptable for modern browsers that deprecated this feature.
Cache-Control could be more restrictive for sensitive content.
checks.detail: For authenticated pages, use "no-store, private" to prevent sensitive data caching.

checks.message: No Set-Cookie header present — no cookie security issues.

checks.message: X-DNS-Prefetch-Control header is missing. DNS prefetching may leak visited links.
checks.detail: DNS prefetching can leak information about which links a user is viewing. Setting this to "off" prevents browsers from pre-resolving external hostnames.
